questions.question_text:
A company uses many Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes. The company wants to use Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager (Amazon DLM) to manage the lifecycle of EBS snapshots that have tags of `Production` and `Compliance`.
Which combination of the following are needed to turn on this feature? (Choose two.)

choices.D: A minimum baseline performance of 3 IOPS/GB
choices.A: A minimum storage requirement of 5 GB
choices.B: One IAM role for Amazon DLM and another IAM role for the users

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
To use Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) to manage the lifecycle of EBS snapshots based on tags, the EBS volumes need to be tagged with appropriate tags, in this case, Production and Compliance.
You need to have two IAM roles set up - one for Amazon DLM to perform the snapshot lifecycle management, and another for the users to have the necessary permissions to create and manage tags on the EBS volumes. These IAM roles will define the access and permissions required for Amazon DLM and the users respectively.

Correct Answer: B & E 
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/snapshot-lifecycle.html
Answer is BE
